comment: If at all possible, avoid her class. She was MIA the entire semester, and didn't give any grading criteria, requirements, or guidance on how to do the essays? The midterm was the worst; it was very heavy and confusing. The final essay wasn't bad, but the group video project was challenging because it's an online class. I don't recommend her class.

Horrible but sweet! She doesn't grade anything for weeks, and this is an 8-week course for summer. The first 5 weeks we have no idea what our grade was! Midterm essay was divided in 2 parts and had to use I think, 5 sources. The final essay you have to work in groups and use 8 sources+video if you work alone it will be 13 sources! Which is absurd.

DO NOT TAKE! She takes forever to grade any work, and then she grades heavily without providing a specific outline of what she was looking for (specifically, the discussion posts). Took this as a summer class and regret it fully! We are required to write 2 heavy essays. The first was over 1,000 words (midterm), and the final requires 13 sources!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: I love professor Williamson- she is super kind and cares about her students. Attendance isn't mandatory but her lectures are super interesting and she's really sweet so I went to most all of the classes. The only downside is that most all of her grades are a few papers and she takes forever to give feedback/grades. Other than that she was great!

joke of a teacher. she didn't grade anything until 3 months in. Barely gave feedback to help us. There are discussion posts every week, the textbook is free. midterm is an essay and final is an essay and group video project. I got an A but it was not worth the hassle for a gen ed class. would've been better if she actually graded so no stress.

Not that many assignments, 2 written responses which are basically essays 1-2 page, a discussion, and final project. Some lectures were graded but if you missed them you could turn a discussion. Final group project was easy( 3-5 min vid & 1inch margin 1-2 page essay about chosen topic), could work on your own. Class was easy just tedious sometimes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor could honestly not exist and I would have no idea. She never graded our work and never emailed back students until weeks later. For being so nonexistent in the course, she's such a tough grader. She graded and critiqued heavily, but would grade so late we could not use that feedback to improve. DO NOT TAKE

Only thing "negative" I can really say about her is that she didn't update grades until like 2 months into the semester. The only assignments were weekly, 1-question discussion post prompt, a midterm paper, and a final group project. If you follow her rubric for the discussion post requirements, it'll be the easiest 100 ever.

As the other reviews say, she doesn't grade things too late. However, she doesn't grade harshly. I think she is a really good professor, so don't let that steer you away. She's not rude or mean, she truly seems to care. Give her some grace. She isn't bad by any means. I would recommend taking her.

She is a nice person.The problem with this class is we had 4 grades for the whole class and she did not grade any of them including the midterm until after the final. If you are a student that likes feedback do not take this class. I tried to reach out multiple times and, never got an answer even though she said she was able to answer at any hour.

She was very educated in what she was teaching and seemed passionate about it but she cancelled a lot of classes and our first grade went into the grade book after the semester was over. She doesn't require attendance and the assignments are easy but she grades kind of harshly.

Very easy class however she takes forever to grade anything. Almost a month since our first assignment and it has been two since our midterm, and no grade yet. She's very kind and tries to keep the class enjoyable but be prepared to have no idea what your grade in the class is for he entirety of the semester.

Very easy class. Doctor Williamson is knowledgeable about every subject she teaches. There are a few essays and a group project at the end of the semester. Class is easy. Just take notes and learn MLA formatting. Very respectful teacher and pretty chill.
rating_tags: Caring--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: There are no tests only essays but she is very chill when grading them. She is very nice and respectful of students time. Spends class lecturing but also opens it up for class discussions (not graded). She knows her content and won't shame for asking questions. The slide shows are posted on D2L and essays are only like once a month.
